Unit tests should only test one feature/scenario at a time, should be fast (to run and mainly to write) and short (when possible). Ideally it shouldn't need any comment if a good naming convention is follow.

Obviously, there is no standard about naming unit tests, but this time (maybe too fast by my side) I used the ```[UnitOfWork_StateUnderTest_ExpectedBehavior]``` described in http://osherove.com/blog/2005/4/3/naming-standards-for-unit-tests.html
